info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 5 at 10:51PM EDT until May 6 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Buffalo NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. The gauge at DSVN6 on the Canseraga Creek rose over one foot in a half hour to 6.1 feet. Impacts are unknown at these levels, but these readings are well above normal.
* WHERE...A portion of western New York, including the following county, Livingston.
* WHEN...Until 445 AM EDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1043 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area, including along the Canseraga Creek and its tributaries. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dansville and Groveland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT TUESDAY
